title: What will be a single discount equivalent to three successive discounts of 15%, 10%, and 5%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well there is a formula if single discount of a, b, c, then the equivalent discount is  30 - 2.75 + .075 that will be 27.325% There is also a basic conceptual way to do this, by ratios 15% means discount means article of 20 sold at 17. 10% means discount means article of 10 sold at 9. 5% means discount means article of 20 sold at 19. response.answer_text: Let's assume that selling price of item is X After first discount of 15%,new selling price = X - X (15/100) = 17X/20 After second discount of 10%,new selling price = 17X/20 - 17X/20 (10/100) = 17X/20 - 17X/200 = 153X/200 After third discount of 5%,new selling price = 153X/200 - 153X/200 (5/100) = 153X/200 - 153X/4000 = 2907X/4000 Total discount = X - 2907X/4000 = 1093X/4000 Total discount % = 100/X (1093X/4000) = 1093/40= 27.325 Stay Home 🙏 Stay Safe 🙏 Enjoy Learning

response.answer_text: Let us consider a amount of 100 Let a discount of 15% is given Discount is ₹15 Amount after discount=100–15=₹85 A discount of10% is given successively Discount amount=(10/100)*85=₹8.5 Amount after discount=85–8.5=₹76.5 A discount of 5% successively Discount amount=(5/100)*76.5=₹3.825 Amount after discount=76.5–3.825=₹72.675 After final successive discount amount is ₹72.675 Ie the single equivalent discount=100–72.675=₹27.325 Hence an equivalent discount is 27.325%
